intro: Helicteres frondosa, commonly known as the broadleaf helicteres, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces capsules containing numerous small seeds.
